ALLEGATION:
Biological parent is not being informed or included in medical/dental treatment and
decision making for their children by the foster care agency.
INVESTIGATION:
Complainant was interviewed via telephone on May 13, 2022. Complainant stated
she was not told about her son being taken to Urgent Care. Complainant stated she
arrived for a scheduled parenting time and waited but her son did not show up.
Complainant stated she contacted the on-call number for the agency and was told
her son had been taken to Urgent Care and was sick and would not be able to
participate with parenting time. Complainant was asked if she had a working phone
at the time and she stated she did. Complainant stated her son recently had a
scheduled dentist appointment and she was not informed of the appointment.
Complainant stated she found out about the appointment when she was asked to
sign his medical passport and saw the appointment listed. Complainant stated the
communication issues have been going on since January 2022. Complainant stated
2

she finds out about appointments when she asks questions or when the agency
asks her to sign something, but she is not notified ahead of time.
Foster Care Supervisor was interviewed face-to-face at the agency on May 16,
2022. Foster Care Supervisor stated Youth A was taken to Urgent Care
approximately 1-2 hours prior to a scheduled parenting time on Saturday March 26,
2022, for symptoms consistent with Hand, Foot, and Mouth. Foster Care Supervisor
stated she was contacted by the on-call staff. Foster Care Supervisor stated she
reviewed MISACWIS and provided the on-call staff with the Complainant’s phone
number. Foster Care Supervisor stated the on-call worker attempted to contact the
Complainant but was unsuccessful. Foster Care Supervisor stated the phone
number listed in MISACWIS for the Complainant was incorrect. Foster Care
Supervisor stated Foster Care Worker (FCW) had the correct phone number for the
Complainant, however, MISACWIS was not updated to reflect the correct
information. Foster Care Supervisor stated FCW notified the complainant of Youth
A’s visit to Urgent Care on Monday March 28, 2022.
Foster Care Supervisor was asked if she was aware if Complainant was made
aware of Youth A’s scheduled dentist appointment on April 29, 2022. Foster Care
Supervisor stated the foster parent did not inform the agency of the appointment
until that morning. Once the agency became aware, the Foster Care Worker
attempted to notify the Complainant but was not receiving any response. Foster
Care Supervisor stated the Complainant later notified the Foster Care Worker she
was not receiving any of the messages. Foster Care Supervisor stated this is the
foster parent’s first placement. The agency has since asked the foster parents to
notify the agency ahead of time of any scheduled appointments.
FCW was interviewed via telephone on May 17, 2022. FCW stated Youth A was
taken to Urgent Care on March 26, 2022, and missed a scheduled parenting time
with the Complainant. FCW stated Youth A was taken to Urgent Care approximately
1-2 hours before parenting time was scheduled to start. FCW stated Complainant’s
phone number was not updated in MISACWIS so when the on-call worker attempted
to notify the Complainant the agency was unable to make contact. FCW stated the
Complainant was notified of Youth A being taken to Urgent Care later in the day on
March 26, 2022. FCW stated the Complainant called the emergency phone line to
inquire if she would be having a parenting time visit with Youth A and was told of the
situation by the agency staff that answered the emergency line. FCW stated the
Complainant did not change her phone number while she was assigned to the case.
FCW stated she did not check MISACWIS to ensure the contact information was
updated.
FCW stated she provided Complainant with a medical passport and reviewed it with
her. FCW stated the dental appointment was completed on April 29, 2022, and
foster parent did not notify FCW until the morning of the appointment. FCW stated
she had previously informed the foster parents to keep her informed when
scheduling medical appointments but in that situation, they only notified her the
3

morning of the appointment. FCW stated the Complainant and foster parents have
contact information for each other and communicate now and then.
Foster Parent was interviewed via telephone on June 1, 2022. Foster Parent stated
Youth A had a scheduled dental appointment on April 29, 2022, in the afternoon.
She stated she notified the FCW of Youth A’s dental appointment around 9am on
April 29, 2022.
Documents Reviewed:
 MISACWIS Case File: Social work contact dated March 26, 2022.
Complainant sent a text message to FCW at 12:17pm advising the foster
parents did not bring Youth A to scheduled parenting time. Complainant sent
a follow-up text message at 12:32pm expressing frustration with not being
told of Youth A’s visit to Urgent Care. Complainant further stated she had to
call the emergency line and find this out from the person that answered
because no one showed up for my visit.
 Social work contact dated March 30, 2022, at 1pm FCW met with
Complainant to discuss her services and parenting time. Complainant was
upset about her parenting time being cancelled on Saturday and that no one
informed her of Youth A going to Urgent Care. FCW explained to
Complainant that this won't happen again as there was a miscommunication
with how it was handled.
 Social work contact dated April 29, 2022, at 9:14am The foster parent texted
the worker that Youth A had a dental appt on April 29, 2022, at 2PM
 Social work contact dated April 22, 2022, April 25, 2022, and April 28, 2022,
and 4/28/2022 FCW sent text message to Complainant but did not receive a
response.
 Social work contact dated May 1, 2022, at 7:15pm Complainant texted FCW
over the weekend the following "Hey my phones been broke I just got my new
one turned on and everything transferred so if you texted me. I'm sorry I didn't
get anything.
 Social work contact dated May 11, 2022, at 3pm, FCW mailed a letter to
foster parents informing them to inform the birth parent and FCW of any
upcoming appointments.
 MISACWIS Case File: There is additional narrative on a few social work
contacts indicating the Complainant has the foster parent’s phone number.
 MISACWIS Case File: Youth A’s health records includes medical passport
dated May 5, 2022, that lists April 29, 2022, dental appointment for Youth A.
Complainant signature obtained on May 10, 2022.
4

APPLICABLE RULE
FOM 801 Health services for children in foster care.
Parental involvement in child’s health care
When a child is placed in out-of-home care, it is important
to involve the birth parents or legal guardians in the child's
medical, dental, developmental, and mental health care.
Parental involvement in and awareness of the child's health
needs and the services and treatment provided to meet these
needs is necessary to promote positive health outcomes.
Caseworkers are to assist and engage the parent/legal guardian
participation in the child's health care by:
 Notifying parents of all health care appointments.
 Inviting parents to attend child's health care
appointments.
 Assisting with and resolving barriers that may prevent
parent's attendance in child's health care appointments.
 Consulting with parents regarding medical decisions
and treatment planning.
ANALYSIS: The agency did not notify the Complainant of Youth A’s visit to
Urgent Care. Attempts were made however MISACWIS did not
contain updated information that was known to the agency. In
addition, the agency did not notify the Complainant of Youth A’s
scheduled dental appointment. The foster parent did not notify
the agency timely; however, it is the agency’s responsibility to
obtain and communicate medical/dental information to the
Complainant timely.
Technical Assistance:
The agency is responsible to keep an up-to-date case record.
Contact information should be updated in MiSACWIS as it
occurs.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change be
made to the license status of this child placing agency.

sir_summary.summary: A Michigan child placing agency failed to notify a biological parent of her child's urgent medical visit and a scheduled dental appointment, violating rules requiring parental involvement in healthcare decisions. The failures stemmed from outdated contact information in the state database and a lack of timely communication from both the foster parent and the agency's caseworker. The investigation concluded the agency is ultimately responsible for ensuring proper notification, establishing a clear violation of policy.

sir_violation_level.justification: The report substantiates that the biological parent was not informed or included in medical/dental treatment and decision-making for their child, including failure to notify the parent about a visit to Urgent Care and a scheduled dental appointment. This constitutes a medical and mental health concern due to missed medical care, unmet treatment needs, and lack of parental involvement in critical health decisions, aligning with the 'severe' category for medical and mental health concerns.
